alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 17 at 11:01PM CST until December 17 at 11:30PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CST FOR IRON AND SOUTHERN ASHLAND COUNTIES... At 1058 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Butternut, or 9 miles west of Turtle Flambeau Flowage, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This snow squall is impacting WI-13 south of Mellen and WI-77 northeast of Clam Lake. Locations impacted include... Turtle Flambeau Flowage, Mercer, Mellen, Butternut, Gurney, Glidden, Upson, Copper Falls State Park, Morse, Pence, Long Lake, Manitowish, Island Lake Iron County, Fisher Lake, Iron Belt, Gile Flowage, Butternut Lake, and Bad River Reservation. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
